attributes.action: Allow UK Licensed Aeronautical engineers obtain dual EASA and UK licences
attributes.additional_details: The government needs to recognise that the UK engineers all obtained their licences within EASA by studying the European syllabus; in the current situation we are heavily disadvantaged as we can only exercise a right to certify UK registered aircraft and are no longer entitled to exercise their right to certify European aircraft. The government should look at negotiating a relationship with EASA similar too Switzerland ensuring an even field between UK engineers and European Engineers applies.
attributes.background: UK licensed Aircraft engineers who prior to Brexit held EASA engineering licences post Brexit no longer valid and can only certify in UK. A European licence holders can still obtain a UK CAA licence for a fee but we can’t obtain an EASA! UK engineers have been de valued in their profession.
